Comment: the usual setup, in the Hungarian Variation of the Sicilian; for black that is... white is lacking the possibility for a swift f4...

black completes development by connecting the rooks, whilst trading that nasty white bishop in the process; at least, that was the plan... Rad1, Bxg2+, Kxg2, is probably best for now, or Bxh3, Qxh3, Rac1...
this move will soon prove to be very inaccurate...
the start of weaving an intricate trap...
greed before the fall... white had no better than Rad1, Bf5, Rf1...
the trap is set...
takes the bait...
SNAP!!!
there are many ways, to prevent the upcoming mate on h2; Re2, Rxe2, Bxe2, to name the best - but losing - one; even h4, Bxb7 is better... but white is totally oblivious...
hook, line and sinker...
